# SHEPHERD-CLASS SALVAGE MOTHERSHIP
[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Medium
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 2-5
[color=#a4885c]Power Gen Type:[/color] Uranium
[color=#a4885c]Expeditions:[/color] None
[color=#a4885c]IFF Console:[/color] None
"A light cargo hauler converted to serve as a mining and salvage mothership for Pioneer-class vessels."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the substation unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the Main Breaker is toggled on for both Starboard APC and Port APC. - Check the current Load (W)* for each APC unit.
## 1.2. S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit
- Check that the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit has fuel. For extended flights make sure that you have enough fuel stockpiled to sustain prolonged power generation during flight. - Check that the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is set to HV output. - Set Target Power to 27-28 [bold]kW[/bold]. - Start the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit.
Note: Be sure to take all necessary protective measures when working with radioactive materials: use a radiation suit, engage internals, and keep radiation shutters closed at all times.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that the oxygen and nitrogen canisters are anchored to their labeled connector ports. - Check that the gas mixer is set to the correct mixing ratio (21% Oxygen, 79% Nitrogen). - Check that the gas mixer is set to 101kPa. - Enable gas mixer.
## 2.2. Waste Loop
- Enable waste loop pump.
## 3. Other Checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the salvage bay and cargo bay blast doors are closed. - Check that the docking arm blast doors are closed if not in use.
## Sidenotes
* - Shepherd-class salvage ships are equipped with two APC units that can be used to appraise the ship's total power consumption. Typical energy usage for an unmodified Shepherd is roughly 25,500 W.
